notes.text: New go-toolset-1.12 packages are now available as a part of Red Hat Developer Tools for Red Hat Enterprise Linux.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Go Toolset provides the Go programming language tools and libraries. Go is alternatively known as golang.

This enhancement update adds the go-toolset-1.12 packages to Red Hat Developer Tools.

For details, see Using Go Toolset linked from the References section.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: net/url in Go before 1.11.13 and 1.12.x before 1.12.8 mishandles malformed hosts in URLs, leading to an authorization bypass in some applications. This is related to a Host field with a suffix appearing in neither Hostname() nor Port(), and is related to a non-numeric port number. For example, an attacker can compose a crafted javascript:// URL that results in a hostname of google.com.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: malformed hosts in URLs leads to authorization bypass
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

For details on how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
This flaw has no mitigation for any affected golang package versions.

vulnerabilities.title: golang: malformed hosts in URLs leads to authorization bypass
